title: Public transport for the A-League Round 4 – Melbourne Victory v Wellington Phoenix: Friday 10 November 2023
articleContent:
Public transport for the A-League Round 4 – Melbourne Victory v Wellington Phoenix: Friday 10 November 2023

Isuzu UTE A League Men’s is back at AAMI Park. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the Melbourne Victory taking on Wellington Phoenix. Extra services will help you get to and from the AAMI Park on Friday 10 November 2023.

The event will begin at 7.45pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Return service from Richmond Station:

  • Belgrave – leaving at 10:06pm from Platform 9
  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 10:01pm from Platform 10
  • Pakenham – leaving at 10:01pm from Platform 6
  • Frankston – leaving at 10:10pm from Platform 4
  • Sandringham – leaving at 10:13pm from Platform 2

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street/Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Passengers can catch the following buses close to AAMI Park:

  • Route 246

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Regional train

Normal services depart from Southern Cross Station.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.
articleDescription: Isuzu UTE A League Men’s is back at AAMI Park. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the Melbourne Victory taking on Wellington Phoenix. Extra services will help you get to and from the AAMI Park on Friday 10 November 2023.
